label: Under the Table and Dreaming
fact: On DMB's first major-label album, the lead single, "What Would You Say", was nominated for two Grammy awards â€” Best Rock Vocal Performance by a Duo or Group and Best Music Video (Short Form).

label: Crash
grammy: Won a Grammy Award for  BEST ROCK PERFORMANCE BY A DUO OR GROUP WITH VOCAL for the track "So Much to Say"
fact: By 2000, "Crash" had sold seven million copies making it DMB's bestselling album to date.

label: Before These Crowded Streets
fact: The album debuted at No. 1 on the Billboard charts, ending the "Titanic" soundtrack's 16-week run at the top.

label: Everyday
fact: This is the first DMB record that features Dave Matthews playing electric guitar.

label: Busted Stuff
grammy: Won a Grammy Award for BEST MALE ROCK VOCAL PERFORMANCE for the track "Gravedigger"
fact: "Busted Stuff" is the first record performed entirely by the core members of the DMB; there are no featured performers.

label: Stand Up
fact: This is the last DMB record before saxophonist LeRoi Moore's death in 2008, though subsequent albums do feature recordings of Moore.

label: Big Whiskey & the GrooGrux King
fact: 44 musicians are featured on the album, including 17 violinists.

label: Away from the World
fact: The music video for "Mercy," the album's lead single, features photo and video contributions from 14,334 DMB fans.

label: Come Tomorrow
fact: The album debuted at No. 1 on the Billboard charts, making DMB the first band to have seven consecutive No. 1 albums.
